info.title: Porting
info.description: NOTE: This spec is written using OpenAPI version 3.1.0. The documentation generator does not support 3.1.0, so it is temporarily marked as 3.0.0 until Redoc supports v3.1.0 Bandwidth understands that number porting is a powerful tool that enables you to bring all your existing voice services under one umbrella. By porting-in your phone numbers to Bandwidth, you mitigate the disruption that comes from changing numbers. With our new Number Porting API, we hope to make this process as smooth as possible! This service allows you to check number portability, submit port-in orders, view statuses, and update in-flight ports.

totalElements.description: Number of port-in orders in total.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of your existing port-in order.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of number you are porting.

parameters.name: currentProviderName
parameters.description: The losing carrier who's currently the operator on the number to be ported in.

parameters.name: customerReference
parameters.description: Parameter that can be used for your own reference, e.g. to uniquely identify one of your customers.

parameters.name: supportRef
parameters.description: Reference of the support ticket associated to the port-in order.

parameters.name: createdDate
parameters.description: Timestamp representing when the initial port-in order was created.

parameters.name: expectedPortCompleteDate
parameters.description: Estimated completion timestamp, calculated by adding lead time to date of submission. Only present once an order has state SUBMITTED.

parameters.name: preferredPortInDate
parameters.description: Date you requested for the porting to be completed in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: submittedDate
parameters.description: Timestamp representing when the order was submitted - only present when relevant.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Parameter specifies at what record to begin the resultset

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Parameter specifies how many results to retrieve

get.description: Allows you to check all existing porting orders for your account using available filters for example the number or current status.

links.description: Indicates all actions you can do with this port-in order based on its status.

phoneNumbers.description: Array of telephone numbers in E164 format.

preferredPortInDate.description: Date that you prefer to have numbers to be available in Bandwidth.

customerReference.description: Parameter that can be used for your own reference, e.g. to uniquely identify one of your customers.

currentProviderName.description: The losing carrier who's currently the operator on the number to be ported in.

post.description:
Allows you to create a porting order in a pending state without documents. These documents must be uploaded for this porting order to be processed successfully.

All porting orders are created in a pending state and will be automatically cancelled after 30 days.

links.description: Indicates all actions you can do with this port-in order based on its status.

get.description: Allows you to check the status of an existing port-in order.

delete.description: Allows you to delete a port-in order in draft. For a cancellation, please use PATCH endpoint.

patch.summary: Submit/Modify/Request cancellation of a port-in order

status.description: Status of a port-in order. Change to "SUBMITTED" For submitting an order, change to "PROCESSING_CANCELLATION" to request cancellation of a port-in order.

currentProviderName.description: The losing carrier who's currently the operator on the number to be ported in.

preferredPortInDate.description: Date that you prefer to have numbers to be available in Bandwidth.

phoneNumbers.description: Array of telephone numbers in E164 format.

patch.description: Allows you to submit or modify a draft port-in order, or to request the cancellation of a submitted port-in order.

schema.description: Success response for number portability check

requirements.description: All required information and documents to provide in order to port your numbers.

currency.description: Currency for porting fees - this is configured in your profile.

numbersToPort.description: List of phone numbers that you requested us to port.

phoneNumbers.description: Array of telephone numbers in E164 format.

post.description: Check if a set of numbers is portable to Bandwidth. Bandwidth internally detects the number type, area code and country code and you can retrieve porting pricing fees and submission requirements.

post.summary: Upload documents for a port-in order
post.description: You are required to upload all the relevant documents for your existing port-in order to be successful depending on the number you are trying to port and which country the number belongs to. You can see the required documents from checking a numbers portability requirements.

links.description: Indicates all actions you can do with this port-in order based on its status.

get.description: Allows you to download specific documents you have uploaded to review for a specific port-in order.

PortInOrder.description: Port-in order details for a number or a set of numbers.

portInOrderId.description: ID generated when you create a port-in order.

currentProviderName.description: The losing carrier who's currently the operator on the number to be ported in.

customerReference.description: Parameter that can be used for your own reference, e.g. to uniquely identify one of your customers.

supportRef.description: Reference of a port order - to use when you contact our support or our porting teams. Eg: PRT25168668606830

preferredPortInDate.description: Specific date you would prefer the port-into be completed.

createdDate.description: Creation date of the port-in order.

lastUpdate.description: Last update date of the port-in order.

submittedDate.description: Timestamp representing when the order was submitted - only present when relevant.

documents.description: Required documents for a port-in order.

ownership.description: Type of ownership of the number to be ported.

complementaryAddressInformation.description: Is used to indicate "In attention to someone".

floor.description: Building number for the end user's address.

buildingIdentifier.description: Building number for the end user's address. E.g. Can put 54 or 54A.

buildingName.description: Building number for the end user's address.

streetName.description: Street name for the end user's address.

streetIdentifier.description: Street code for the end user's address. E.g. addresses in Japan

postalCode.description: Postal code for the end user's address.

municipalityIdentifier.description: Municipality code for the end user's address. E.g. 50026 for Pisa in Italia.

city.description: City name for the end user's address.

state.description: State of the end user's address.

title.description: Title of the end user or company legal representative.

firstName.description: First name of personal end user or company legal representative.

middleName.description: Middle name of the personal end user or company legal representative.

lastName.description: Surname of personal end user or company legal representative.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of personal end user or company legal representative.

companyName.description: Registered company name. Only present for business ownership type.

companyVatNumber.description: Registered VAT number - only present for business ownership.

companyRegistrationNumber.description: Registration number - only present for business ownership.

MailBox.description: Virtual or physical mailbox of the owner of the number.
MailBox.title: MailBox

buildingIdentifier.description: Building number for the end user's mailbox. E.g. Can put 54 or 54A.

buildingName.description: Building number for the end user's mailbox.

complementaryAddressInformation.description: Is used to indicate "In attention to someone".

streetName.description: Street name for the end user's mailbox.

streetIdentifier.description: Street code for the end user's mailbox. E.g. addresses in Japan

postalCode.description: Postal code for the end user's mailbox.

municipalityIdentifier.description: Municipality code for the end user's mailbox. E.g. 50026 for Pisa in Italia.

city.description: City name for the end user's mailbox.

state.description: State of the end user's mailbox.

PhoneNumberDetails.description: Telephone numbers to port and related porting details

phoneNumber.description: Phone number in E164 format that the portability check response is executed against. E.g: +19995550123, +33123456789.

type.description: Type of phone number. E.g. Geographic, Toll-free.

countryCallingCode.description: Country calling code. E.g. 44 for UK

leadTime.description: Amount of time it takes to complete a order in a happy flow from the moment of submission.

internalMigration.description: Indicates if the port is an internal migration (means the number is already in our network).

portable.description: Indicates if the number is portable.

Fees.description: Fees that you have to pay for a number or a set of numbers. The currency will depend on your configuration.

portFees.description: Fees for porting-in a number or a set of numbers.

cancellationFees.description: Cancellation fees of a submitted number or a set of numbers.

phoneNumberMonthlyFees.description: Monthly recurring charge for owning a number or a set of numbers.

Link.description: All actions that you can do for a port-in order, document or a support ticket or a comment in a support ticket.

Document.description: Required documents for porting-in a number or a set of numbers.

documentId.description: Generated ID for an uploaded document.

content.description: Content of a file in binary

status.description: Status of a document - any new uploaded document will be marked as PENDING_VALIDATION and needed to be validated by our porting team.

examples.description: Hi there, The cancellation request for your port has been successfully processed.

SupportTicket.title: SupportTicket

comments.description: Hi there, The cancellation request for your port has been successfully processed.

SupportTicket.description: Support ticket associated to the port-in order.

comments.description: Any comments in the support tickets.

BusinessRequirement.description: All requirements (documents and end user's information) customers have to provide for porting-in a number.

Error.description: Generated error due to a bad request.

source.description: Contains references to the source of the error,

field.description: Missing field or field having the issue.

nextToken.description: Represents going to the “next” page. This parameter will be absent if there isn't any next pagination.

previousToken.description: Represents going to the “previous” page. This parameter will be absent if there isn't any previous pagination.
